intro: Ophiorrhiza lauterbachii, commonly known as the Lauterbach's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and thrives on the branches of host trees, primarily in tropical rainforests. The plant has small, opposite leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that disperses seeds through wind or animals. Due to its parasitic nature, it plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its host species and forest ecosystems.
